name: Courtyard by Marriott Stockholm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel, but the high rankings in Tripadvisor may cause high expectations that are not necessarily met.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but service need improvement

reviews.text: The facilities are very good; the hotel is new, clean and light. The room was nicely decorated and the toilet was good. The breakfast buffet was also very comprehensive and of good quality.
reviews.title: Automatic building site wake-up call

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall out stay would have been very enjoyable if it was not for a few negative things that gave us the impression that the hotel was not yet fully up to speed:
reviews.title: Greatest hotel stay of my life

reviews.text: - When arriving in our room, the TV was not working as someone had pulled the power cord out.
reviews.title: So very impressed with this new addition to Stockholm

reviews.text: - The curtain in our room broke when trying to open it. When calling the reception, they informed that they did not have anyone to fix it during the weekend. The curtain had however been fixed later the same day.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but away from city center

reviews.text: This hotel is a bit nicer and has a more upscale feeling than most of the Courtyards I've stayed in. It has a number of meeting rooms and has a good business hotel feeling to it.
reviews.title: Good for business, ok for vacation

reviews.text: It's close to the subway but not that easy to find - I had to ask several people for help and even then had trouble. Road work currently in the area makes the hotel difficult to see. Once at the subway station it's very easy to get wherever you need to go. The area is nothing special from a tourist perspective, but has plenty of restaurants nearby if you're ending your day there.
reviews.title: Ok+

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is outstanding.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and staff, nice gym, but not a so ggod location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is very friendly.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great hotel with a nice restaurant called Björk Bar & Grill. The service is weak but the food is way better. A bit far from the center.
reviews.title: Up-to-date hotel with great accessibility
Fatal Flaw: Accessability
reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel. Rooms are large, view is spectacular (especially if you face south), breakfast is excellent, staff is super helpful.

BUT. Access to the T-bana station is on the north side of the building and the entrance is on the south side. The road on the north side slopes along the building, where there are several entrances, including a very convenient staff entrance.
reviews.title: Clean, Nice, Attentive... Well worth the money

reviews.text: GUESTS, however, are apparently not expected to use public transportation. They must either take three flights of stairs on the east side, or go further around the building and take one flight of stairs on the west side to get to their entrance. So don't come here with rolling bags in tow. Don't come here if you would like accessible access unless you come in a taxi.
reviews.title: great new hotel with wonderful service

reviews.text: I come to Stockholm frequently, and this hotel is among the best values in town. I would come again, except that the location dictates use of the (excellent) public transportation system, while the hotel doesn't seem to understand that guests would expect to access such transportation conveniently. So I probably won't be back.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: I spent the better part of two months trying to find a reasonably priced room in Stockholm after making my flight reservations. I found a ton of places but most had mixed reviews at best and in trying to stay in the $150USD/night range I couldn't find something that looked nice. Then I found advanced booking rates at this hotel, read the reviews, and decided to book.
reviews.title: Bad Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As usual, I consulted TripAdvisor before booking a hotel room and yet again wasn't disappointed. The Stockholm Marriott is a great hotel - large rooms with panoramic views of the City, modern bathrooms with power showers and lovely robes and slippers, huge beds, great breakfast with a wide variety of options, polite and helpful staff, very well equipped gym and a very decent restaurant (Bjork Bar and Grill - we ate there a couple of times, and it was some of the best food we had in Sweden). There is a 24 hour shop on the ground floor which sells snacks and essentials, and free 24 hour internet on the 3rd floor. There are also welcome extras like being able to store your luggage at the hotel if you take an overnight trip out of Stockholm. The only possible downside about the hotel is that it isn't in the city centre. However, having researched this fully before booking this hotel, this means that you get nigh-on 5 star hotel quality for half the price you would pay in the city centre. Also, the walk along Lake Malern into Gamla Stan (about 20 mins) is very pleasant, and we did this every day during our stay. It is also easy to get the bus back if you've had too much walking for one day, or the T-bana as both stop within 5 minutes walk of the hotel. If we ever go back to Stockholm, it will be to this hotel, and will be recommending it to anyone that mentions the possibility of a trip to Stockholm.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: Probably best Courtyard I've ever stayed. Surpasses other "proper" Marriott and Reneissance hotels. Brand new hotel, taxi driver didn't even know how to get there. Big room, clean bath (just a shower - typical Scandinavian). Lots of English channels on tv, including movies (free). Food was a bit too poshy to my liking so I was eating out, there's a nice Greek restaurant jus 10 minutes (walking) away.
reviews.title: pretty good and brand new

reviews.text: I was lucky enough to be upgraded to a suite when I checked-in. It was fabulous, large and a lot of attention to details. The highlight had to be the jacuzzi in the bathroom with a view over the park. The breakfast buffet was also great, good choice of cold cuts and cheeses, bread and fruit juices. The location is not central but very easy to travel by T-Bana which is about a 5-10 minute walk away.
reviews.title: Stylish luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's really not in the centre-centre but the undeground is close, not too far from Gamlastan. For bus stop you just need to cross the street. The hotel is modern and green (if you know what I mean). The light come on when you step out of the elevator. The room was very clean.
reviews.title: New hotel, Nice Hotel, Clean and modern!
Worth checking out
reviews.text: The service is excellent, Front Desk is very open and ready to help.
